Description: Gold ear-ring; hollow ring with circular section, narrowing towards the terminals; one end is twisted into a hoop, around which the other, thinner terminal is wound.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2468)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 118, Tomb 66)
Laffineur et al. 1986 / Amathonte III. Testimonia 3. L'Orfèvrerie. Scarabées, scaraboïdes et cônes. La coupe en argent du British Museum (No. 90, p. 28)
